elements.title: The Creative Gene (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in his book The Creative Gene, Hideo Kojima (pictured) revealed that he would sacrifice his position as a game designer to go to outer space?

elements.title: Fred Vehmeier (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that of newly hired coach Fred Vehmeier, one newspaper said: "Any candidate for the university football team who gets a bit sassy can count on a beating, if this new coach is the man he looks to be"?

elements.title: a 19th-century horse stable (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a 19th-century horse stable in New York City later housed a luxury pet sitter for cats and dogs?

elements.title: Johan Floderus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in September 2023, The New York Times publicly confirmed the detention of Johan Floderus in Iran a year and a half after his arrest?

elements.title: The Sims 2: Pets (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a reviewer for the PS2 version of The Sims 2: Pets was disappointed that it didn't let him drown the animals?

elements.title: Yunus Emre coal-fired power station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Yunus Emre coal-fired power station is licensed to operate after Turkey's goal for net zero?

elements.title: a California radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the founder of a California radio station "didn't want to do background music"?

elements.title: Juana Summers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that All Things Considered host Juana Summers is a competitive pinball player?
